title: Mitt Romney, eldest son in talks to buy a piece of the Yankees
text:
Mitt Romney, eldest son in talks to buy a piece of the Yankees The Romneys have been trying to break into the MLB racket for a while now. Slot to 247Sports Links 
Former Massachusetts governor and Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney could soon own a piece of one of the most successful sports franchises in the world. According to a report by Jon Heyman of FanRag Sports , Romney and his eldest son are putting together a bid for a small percentage of the New York Yankees. 
Mitt and Tagg Romney and family are bidding to buy a small stake in the Yankees months after their try for the Marlins stalled. 
Theyâ€™re expected to pay $25 million to $30 million per point and thought to be interested in one or two points. The Yankees are valued around $3 billion or more. 
The Romneys are said to have offered $1.4 billion many months back to buy the Miami Marlins. But that appears to be off the table now, as the Romneys are talking about buying a very small piece of the Yankees instead. 
Romney has previously shown interest in the Marlins and Dodgers but both of those pursuits came up empty. The 69-year-old has previous experience in sports management, having served as CEO of the organizing committee for the 2002 Winter Olympics in Salt Lake City. Before entering politics, Romney had a long career in business management and consulting, eventually ascending to the CEO of Bain Capital. Romney and his wife have an estimated net worth of $250 million. If the deal goes through, some Yankees fans might have a hard time coming to terms with the fact that the former Massachusetts governor is reportedly a Red Sox fans. Author
